man arrested after cannabis raid in rotherham .

york university researchers identify new species of bat .

documents.title: our top five stories today
text: here is a look back at some of our top stories from today :

documents.title: huddersfield town : team news ahead of first premier league game
text: huddersfield start their premier league campaign tomorrow , away at crystal palace .
huddersfield 's record signing steve mounie and winger tom ince are among nine summer recruits hoping to play .
newly-appointed captain tommy smith should be fit after a foot injury but jonathan hogg and nahki wells are both out with ankle problems .

ahead of their first match in the top-flight , terriers manager david wagner said : '' we said this last season very often , over a long , long time , it 's unrealistic for huddersfield town to be in the premier league .
he added `` i think we 've shown that even the impossible is possible in football .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weekend weather for yorkshire
text: some sunshine on the cards this weekend after a cloudy end to friday .
there 's the the risk of a little light rain or drizzle for a time this evening althoug it is tending to improve with some clear spells later on .
a minimum temperature of 13 c .
tomorrow we 're looking at sunny spells along with a few showers and a maximum temperature of 20c .
sunday will be mostly dry with some decent sunny spells .
author: Keeley Donovan
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: sheffield 's 'man with the pram ' to attend rangers game
text: sheffield 's 'man with the pram ' is to attend a rangers game this weekend after he was verbally abused by some of their fans .
author: Sheffield Star

documents.title: firefighter frees swan in wakefield
text: a swan in wakefield had to be rescued this morning after it got stuck in a weir .
the rspca called in west yorkshire fire and rescue service ( wyfrs ) after the swan became trapped at newmillerdam in sandle at 10:00 this morning .
the bird was stuck on a flat ledge two feet down from the from the dam and was very tired .
as a crowd of people looked on , a firefighter in water rescue gear and attached to a line went out and lifted to the swan to freedom .
firefighter tony campbell managed to coax the swan back into clear water and according to wyfrs `` the swan swam away happily and the crowd cheered ! ''
he said `` it was an unusual rescue , i have never rescued a swan before but i 'm happy it ended well and the swan was uninjured . ''
the swan was running away from me but eventually i managed get a grip of it and return it to the dam . ''

documents.title: have you seen missing 16 year old from bradford ?
text: a teenager from bradford has gone missing , police say that he is `` known to walk around sucking on his thumb '' .
sixteen-year-old philip docherty was last seen in bridge street in the city centre at about 19:00 yesterday .
he was last seen wearing a navy quilted coat , dark grey tracksuit bottoms , a light grey t-shirt and blue and black trainers .
if you think you may have seen him , call the police in bradford on 101 .

documents.title: watch : do you overtake cyclists safely ?
text: how much room do you allow when overtaking a cyclist ?
it should be no less than 1.5 metres or you could be in trouble with south yorkshire police .
that 's because officers wearing cameras on bicycles are riding around sheffield and doncaster under a new scheme called `` safe pass '' .
if they capture footage of any dangerous overtaking it will be used to trace the driver and potentially issue them with a fine .
several cycling organisations across the county had been explaining to the force the dangers they 've faced out on the roads .

documents.title: terriers defender hefele signs new deal
text: terriers defender hefele signs new deal

documents.title: pontefract man among 11 convicted after slavery trials
text: eleven people have been convicted after a major police investigation into modern slavery including cases in lincolnshire .
those convicted were tried in a series of linked trials at nottingham crown court .
'operation pottery ' was one of the largest investigations of its kind in the uk , lincolnshire police said .

eleven people have now been convicted of offences including ; conspiracy to forced or compulsory labour ; conspiracy to defraud ; fraud by false representation ; theft and converting criminal property .
the uk human trafficking centre said that 18 men were illegally trafficked .
police say they were often forced to live in `` shocking '' conditions ( above ) .
most of those convicted were members of the same family .
they will be sentenced in early september .
their living quarters were truly shocking and at times the men resided in site stables next to the dog kennels . ''

documents.title: egg contamination scare : asda withdraws products from shelves
text: leeds-based supermarket asda has announced it is withdrawing several products from sale after the contaminated egg scare .
fifteen eu countries as well as hong kong and switzerland have received eggs contaminated with the insecticide fipronil , the european commission says .
asda released a statement saying : `` following precautionary advice from the food standards agency , we have withdrawn three fresh salad lines from sale . ''
they added `` customers should be reassured by the fsa 's explanation that this decision is not due to food safety concerns and there is unlikely to be any risk to public health ''
the affected products are :

documents.title: folk singer explores robin hood 's bay
text: eliza carthy is one of england 's finest folk performers .
in this episode of the radio 4 programme open country eliza explores her hometown of robin hood 's bay .
famed for shipwrecks , smugglers and fossils eliza uncovers the true history of the place she calls home through those who know it 's history and secrets best .
author: BBC Radio 4

documents.title: fancy your name on the vulcan aircraft plaque ?
text: would you like to have your name engraved on the side of an iconic british aircraft ?

you may be in luck , because the vulcan to the sky trust are offering you the chance to be part of a new plaque commemorating 10 years since the avro vulcan xh558 took flight again ( below ) after a restoration project .
the vulcan had air crew from lincolnshire and was based at raf waddington during the cold war .
the donation in exchange for your name will be used to help build a new hangar for the aircraft at the robin hood airport .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: rotherham raid reveals cannabis crop worth half a million pounds
text: a man has been arrested after officers uncovered £ 500,000 of cannabis during a pre-planned police operation .
at around 20:30 yesterday evening officers visited two properties on henley grove road in masbrough where around 500 cannabis plants were found .
a 26-year-old man was arrested on sus of production of cannabis and is currently being questioned by police .

documents.title: union 's call for 'real living wage '
text: the gmb union is calling on sheffield council to ask its waste operator , veolia , to pay staff a real living wage or it will ballot for industrial action .
the real living wage , calculated by the living wage foundation , currently stands at £ 8.45 an hour - higher than the government 's national living wage of £ 7.50 an hour .
all the firm 's staff in sheffield are paid above the national living wage , according to veolia .

documents.title: four-year-old harrogate boy to star with russian state opera
text: a four-year-old boy from north yorkshire 's been to star in madame butterfly .
the russian state opera is performing in harrogate at the end of the month and wanted to cast a local child for the role of madame buttefly 's son .
here 's maxim 's dad mike and the star himself :

documents.title: watch : top tips on how to watch the perseid meteor shower in yorkshire
text: this weekend we 're promised an amazing view of the perseid meteor shower , which is due to be at its height tomorrow night .
the weather 's actually looking clear ( for once ) around yorkshire , which means that between 23:00 on saturday night and 04:00 on sunday morning we could be treated to a spectacular display .
you can learn much more about the shower here , but if you feel like you know enough , you can still see some top tips on getting the best view :

documents.title: sheffield plaque for sgt arnold loosemore vc
text: a plaque honouring a world war one soldier awarded the victoria cross for bravery and devotion to duty has been unveiled in sheffield .
sgt arnold loosemore of the 8th battalion duke of wellington 's regiment won the medal on 11 august 1917 when he single-handedly engaged the enemy .
he was one of seven loosemore brothers from the city to serve in the war .
the plaque at the cenotaph is part of a national scheme to remember all world war one recipients of the medal .

documents.title: hunt on for pair caught on camera disturbing rare birds ' nest
text: police are hunting for two armed men who they believe have tried to kill rare birds of prey in north yorkshire .
what 's thought to be the first pair of marsh harriers to begin breeding in the county for many years built a nest on denton moor .
but two men with guns have been filmed ( visiting the nest several times and are thought to have tried to shoot one of the birds before removing all the eggs .

pc bill hickson , who is investigating the incident , said : `` the video evidence provided by the rspb shows illegal activity around a marsh harrier nest , and the activity shown speaks for itself . ''
you can watch the video by clicking here and scrolling to the bottom of the page .

documents.title: vr headsets educating young people about car accidents
text: a hard-hitting virtual reality film is being used in south yorkshire to encourage safer driving .
the point-of-view simulation , at thorne fire station in doncaster , shows young viewers what it is like to be in a car accident , and then be cut out of the wreckage by a fire crew .

documents.title: watch : 'a boyhood dream ' - one man and his spitfire
text: deep in a secret yorkshire location , a boyhood dream has become a reality .
matt russell has built his own spitfire from scratch .
it 's now up for sale , and matt says after four years of graft the starting price is about £ 160,000 :

text: weather watcher sandie nicholson took this stunning shot of damflask reservoir , just west of sheffield .
feeling reflective ?

documents.title: fire at high-rise cladding failure site at landmark house
text: crews were called to a high-rise block of flats in bradford city centre which failed government fire safety tests following a light socket fire .
author: Bradford Telegraph and Argus

documents.title: in m1 tanker crash
text: a tanker which crashed through the central reservation on the m1 at j47 near leeds yesterday afternoon caused hours of delays for drivers .
these released by highways england show the extent of the crash and just how lucky the driver was to escape with a suspected fractured leg :

documents.title: police hunt man after fire at sheffield flats
text: police want to speak to this man about a fire at a block of flats in willey street , just off the wicker , in sheffield in june .
at around 06:35 on tuesday 27 june , emergency services were called to the north bank flats on willey street following reports of a fire .
the sixth floor of the flats was evacuated and two residents were rescued by south yorkshire fire and rescue crews .
no one was hurt during the incident but extensive damage was caused to the building .
officers believe the man has vital information and they are appealing for anyone who may know him , or who witnessed the incident , to contact them .

documents.title: travel update : problems on a58 ( m ) in leeds
text: and a quick one for fans of cctv images of traffic jams , here 's the queue towards the gyratory .
to be fair traffic around city square is fine , so it looks like the delays are confined to the a58 ( m ) .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: travel update : central leeds 'gridlocked ' by accident
text: looks like the problems in central leeds are being caused at the armley gyratory .
you know it 's bad when the word `` gridlock '' is being banded about :
# leeds due accident avoid the a58m and armley gyratory area , accident at gyratory .
road gridlocked and buses delayed in leeds .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: travel update : crash in leeds causing 'extensive ' delays
text: one to watch out for if you 're in leeds city centre this morning :
road traffic accident - a58 ( m ) inner ring west bound adjacent to the wellington street entry slip , lanes 2 and 3 closed - extensive queues
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: midfielder o'kane extends leeds deal
text: midfielder o'kane extends leeds deal

documents.title: listen : countdown to north yorkshire asphalt plant decision
text: planners are recommending that a proposed new asphalt plant near york should be given the go-ahead .
hundreds of people have objected to plans for the site at hessay near the a59 , worried about pollution , increased traffic and the impact they say it would have on greenbelt land .
the company behind it says it 's worked with the council to address these issues .
city of york councillors will have the final say at a meeting next week .
niki doeg , who lives in hessay and is campaigning against the plant , says she hopes councillors listen properly to those against the plans :

documents.title: ikea announces opening date for new sheffield store
text: the doors of home furnishing retailer ikea 's new sheffield store will officially open for business on thursday 28 september , it 's been confirmed .
the firm has confirmed that all 380 jobs at the new store at tinsley have now been filled , including posts in customer relations , sales , interior design and in the ikea restaurant .
an additional 100 jobs have also been created at a new call centre , the company says .

documents.title: landlord charged over boys ' fire deaths
text: landlord charged over boys ' fire deaths

documents.title: teenage bikers seriously injured in crash
text: two teenagers suffered serious injuries after the motorcycle they were riding was in collision with a car in bradford last night .
it happened at about 21:45 as they were travelling along dick lane towards dudley hill when their bike was in collision with a red seat ibiza at the junction with sutton road (
the riders , boys aged 15 and 16 , were treated by paramedics at the scene before being taken to hospital with serious injuries .
the driver of the car , a 19-year-old man , was uninjured .
officers are appealing for anyone who saw either vehicle in the time before the crash or who witnessed the collision itself to get in touch .

documents.title: listen : fans hope huddersfield 's promotion will mean big boost for town
text: are big things are on the way for huddersfield as the terriers prepare for life in football 's premier league ?
fans say they hope promotion will bring new jobs and millions of pounds of investment to huddersfield .
lifelong terriers fan rob highans will be at crystal palace tomorrow for their first match in the top-flight and he thinks promotion will work wonders for the town :

documents.title: watch : a cloudy day for yorkshire with some rain
text: turning increasingly cloudy today across yorkshire with outbreaks of rain spreading from the west .
most of this rain fairly light and patchy , with a few heavier bursts especially on high ground .
watch my full forecast here :
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: south yorkshire police to target drivers passing too close to bikes
text: how much room do you give to cyclists when you 're overtaking ?
several cycling groups across the county have complained to south yorkshire police about dangerous overtaking .
the force has now agreed to set up a `` safe pass '' initiative .
it 'll see see officers riding bikes in sheffield and doncaster wearing cameras to record offenders who overtake dangerously and give less than a 1.5m clearance .
author: Kate Linderholm
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: watch : the final day - sheffield 's special olym
text: it 's the last day of the special olym in sheffield today .
the city 's played host to the national games for athletes with learning disabilities over the last five days .
we 've followed the games throughout the week and here are some of the faces we 've met along the way :

documents.title: meet the happy bat formerly known as yoda
text: scientists in york have identified a new breed of bat .
it was found in a remote rainforest in papua new guinea and was nicknamed yoda due to its resemblance to the star wars jedi master .
but now , biologists at the university of york have given it the official name of `` the happy tube-nosed fruit bat '' since its round jaw gives the impression it 's constantly smiling .
naturalists at the university examined literature and 3,000 specimens in 18 museums around the world before they could formally distinguish and register happy as a new species .
bat species often look similar to each other , but differ significantly in behaviour , feeding and history . ''

documents.title: man charged over huddersfield house fire in which two boys died
text: a huddersfield man has been charged in connection with a fatal house fire in the town last year in which two boys died .
three-year-old logan taylor and his brother jake casey , aged two , died in the fire on alder street , fartown , on saturday 20 february 2016 .
the 50-year-old man , from birkby , is due to appear before kirklees magistrates ' court on friday 18 august charged with two counts of gross negligence manslaughter .

documents.title: bizarre map reveals 'best place ' in yorkshire to avoid ww3 nuclear missile strike
text: an estate agent has put together a bizarre map which it says highlights the best places to live in yorkshire and the uk if you fear for the nation 's impending doom .
this map apparently highlights the zones which would be wiped out by a nuclear strike on one of 20 major cities - and where you 'd be safe .
author: Yorkshire Post

documents.title: yorkshire 's friday forecast
text: a dry start , but cloud and outbreaks of rain will spread quickly southeast through the morning .
rain will continue through the afternoon , but with some drier and perhaps brighter intervals in the east .
remaining rather cloudy through the evening with further outbreaks of rain , the heaviest over western hills .
this will gradually ease overnight with clear spells continuing in the east .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: talks to avert doncaster bin strike
text: talks are due to be held today between the unite union and the company which empties bins in doncaster in a bid to try to avert a walkout planned for 23 august .
unite members are in dispute with suez over pay and jobs .
it 's already led to industrial action in birmingham , with rubbish left uncollected there .
the union said suez made a 2 % pay offer , conditional on the removal of guaranteed overtime .
it said this would mean most workers not receiving an increase .
the company is also planning job cuts , unite claims .

at the time of the strike announcement , nick browning , of suez recycling and recovery uk , said unite members on the doncaster contract received a significant pay award last december , and the union 's current demands were `` unrealistic '' .
the pay award was `` not conditional on employees sacrificing overtime payments '' , he added .

documents.title: calls for bypass around a64 village
text: there are renewed calls to improve safety on a road where a couple from leeds died on their wedding day .
in just over a year , the a64 between york and scarborough is said to have claimed 11 lives , including those of paul and susan dockerty .

the couple had just got married and were travelling in a car with derek and joy green , who were guests at the wedding in july last year when a head-on crash with a lorry on the a64 at scampston bridge , between malton and scarborough , killed all four .
now , campaigners are calling for a bypass around the village of rillington ( near malton .
highways england says there are currently no major plans to build one .

documents.title: check your train journey this morning
text: if you 're heading out to catch a train this morning , you 'll be glad to know the services across our region seem to be generally running to time at the moment .

however , be aware that the the 07:01 york to king 's cross service has been cancelled and the 06:00 leeds to plymouth and 06:52 sheffield to plymouth services are currently running about an hour late .
you can click on the links below to keep up to date with the live departure boards for :
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: asda and morrisons ditch egg products amid europe contamination scandal
text: four supermarkets , including bradford-based morrisons and leeds-based asda , have taken products off their shelves in the wake of the egg contamination scare .

the food standards agency ( fsa ) said yesterday that the scale of the problem was higher than previously thought , with about 700,000 eggs having been sent to the uk from potentially contaminated dutch farms - up from an early estimate of 21,000 .
in response , asda , morrisons , sainsbury 's and waitrose have withdrawn a total of 11 products - including sandwiches , sandwich fillers and salads - from sale .

the fsa said investigations suggested it was `` very unlikely '' that the eggs posed a risk to public health as it released a list of processed products withdrawn in the uk `` to ensure that consumers are protected '' .
for the full list of affected products , click here .

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage across yorkshire
text: hello and welcome to bbc local live in yorkshire on friday 11 august 2017 .
we 'll be with you throughout the day with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather updates .
as always , we welcome your input - like this bbc weather watcher scene of pastoral splendor at wortley in barnsley .
if you 've a cracking photo or something else interesting to share , you can do so by simply clicking here .
author: Andrew Barton
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire
